intro: Aylostera tamboensis, commonly known as the Natal wildbean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Aylostera tamboensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
